intro: Galium karataviense, commonly known as Karatavian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium karataviense is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cooler, temperate climates.
